section.title: Object not found in heap
section.screen: HTTP ERROR 500 com.apexidentity.model.NodeException: ['file:/Users/jamie/.ApexIdentity/Gateway/config.json'].heap.objects[2].config.filterObjects[0]: object not found in heap at com.apexidentity.heaplet.HeapUtil.getRequiredObject(HeapUtil.java:54) at com.apexidentity.filter.Chain$Heaplet.create(Chain.java:49)
section.para: You have a filter specified in the filterObjects list in the Chain Object that is not in the config.json. Make sure you have added an entry for the Filter and have correctly spelled it's name in the filterObjects list.

section.title: Could not find local configuration file
section.screen:
HTTP ERROR 500 Problem accessing /. Reason:
could not find local configuration file at /var/root/.ApexIdentity/Gateway/config.json or bootstrap file at /var/root/.ApexIdentity/Gateway/_private_var_folders_zz_zzzivhrRn Amviuee____________-Tmp-_Jetty_0_0_0_0_80_root_war____z5zq2_webinf.json
section.para: The Gateway could not find it's configuration file in the home directory of the user running the container deploying the Gateway. In this case /var/root/.ApexIdentity/Gateway/config.json. As you can see from the error message, the Gateway will look in a secondary location determined at runtime by the container. The secondary location is only necessary if you are running more than one Gateway on a single host and they are not sharing a single configuration.

section.title: Unexpected character (x) at position 1103
section.screen:
HTTP ERROR 500 Problem accessing /. Reason:
Unexpected character (x) at position 1103
section.para: This error usually means a missing double quote or a missing bracket in the configuration file. Make sure all of your double quotes and brackets match up.

section.title: The values from my flat file are incorrect.
section.para: Ensure the flat file is readable by the user running the container of the Gateway. Values are all characters, including space and tabs, between the separator, so ensure the values are not padded with spaces.

section.title: Problem accessing URL
section.screen:
HTTP ERROR 500
Problem accessing /myURL . Reason:
java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.util.List Caused by:
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.util.List at com.apexidentity.filter.LoggingFilter.writeHeaders(LoggingFilter.java:132) at com.apexidentity.filter.LoggingFilter.logResponse(LoggingFilter.java:119) at com.apexidentity.filter.LoggingFilter.filter(LoggingFilter.java:86) at com.apexidentity.filter.Chain.handle(Chain.java:54)
section.para: This error is typically encountered when using the [[AssignmentFilter]] and setting a string value for one of the Headers. All headers are stored in Lists so must be addressed with a subscript. For example, if you were trying to set exchange.request.headers['Location'] for a redirect in the response object, you should be setting exchange.request.headers['Location'][0]. Setting it without a subscript will lead to the error above.
